bug.author: TiasM
bug.summary: [BUG] Labelme2voc.py can't convert JSON to XML using binary image (mask image)
bug.description:
Hi, i'd like to ask when i try to make XML bounding-box annotation from mask image (binary image), the labelme2voc.py genereate an error while converting the JSON file to XML What i did:
Provide mask image (binary image) to data_annotated folder Open labelme.exe to make the bounding-box and generate the JSON file Run the labelme2voc.py file Got error. This is the screenshot of the error
this is the sample of image i am using: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45141188/83031485-ce7eae00-a05e-11ea-90fd-ce970c6f1d5d.png></denchmark-link>
and this is the original image: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45141188/83031613-f9690200-a05e-11ea-8e82-971a939ce40f.png></denchmark-link>
Does this has anything to do with the binary image itself ? Because i tried using the original image (colored) and it works just fine. Not sure what's wrong Note :
The binary mask image i am using is from http://groups.inf.ed.ac.uk/f4k/GROUNDTRUTH/RECOG/ I personally modify the labelme2voc.py a little bit (so it can read and generate .PNG image file instead of .JPG because the dataset i am using are all using .PNG format, but that's all that i change, not more)
Thank You, and sorry for the bad english.

comments.comment: It worked with no error on my env. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4310419/85444019-cf393000-b589-11ea-83e7-bb2c0fcf86f4.png></denchmark-link>

Hi, thanks for the reply.After i read some discussion on the web, seems like problem is caused by the binary image itself which can't be process by PIL. However i'm not sure why it's working on your env. Since i already find the way to work around this problem for my case, it's ok now. I'll just close the issue, Thank You :)
